name: Black Infant Health Program
description: The Black Infant Health Program is California's community-based program providing group support and education to Black women and birthing people during pregnancy and the first year of their baby's life.
fullDescription: The Black Infant Health Program is California's community-based program providing group support and education to Black women and birthing people during pregnancy and the first year of their baby's life.
whatTheyOffer:
- Weekly group sessions during pregnancy
- Postpartum support groups
- Life skills and stress management
- Health education and resources
- Social support and community building
- Connection to prenatal care
- Baby supplies and incentives
- Available in 18+ California counties
howToGetIt: Contact your local Black Infant Health program through the state website. Programs are free and open to Black women and birthing people age 18+ who are pregnant or recently gave birth.
keywords: Black Infant Health, BIH, African American, pregnancy, maternal health, prenatal, postpartum, birth outcomes, support group, Black mothers
